title: Is Kanye West the best rapper of this generation? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes, this is a no brainer. He has arguably the best discography of all-time as far as rap goes. His albums generally receive exemplary reviews from critics & the public.He’s one of the more creative rappers of all-time. During the early years of his career he gave a new, distinctive, and innovative perspective on rap. He covered things out of the norm for that time period in the mainstream spotlight. He also isn’t confined by a specific sub-genre or sound, he makes…music.Kanye has influenced countless artists of the new generation & has become a household name (including Drake & Cole).Many sources regeard him as one of the top live performers in rap today.He’s been relevant for well over a decade, which is hard to do in the rap game. For the most part he’s showing no signs of regression.Note: You don’t have to be a master lyricist to be considered one of the greatest, there’s more to hip-hop than that. Even so, Kanye is considered to be one of the best writers of the past 2 decades.

No. In this generation hell no. The man was genius back in the early 2000s. Worldwide hits and at the time. If there were interviews he only discussed about the music and the craft. Now he’s in a place where people don’t see him as an artist or a rapper, they see him more as a dumb ass, because of his act of support in Trump. He exploited himself by his unusual behavior between that and paparazzi. Recently he’s been quiet about politics and more spiritual, because he sees that him being a black individual supporting someone who doesn’t treat minorities equally in this country has effected his reputation. But if he didn’t get criticized for it, he would still be Trump’s puppet and I still think he is.
